FuncDef:
The remote-backup interface peer command specifies an interface of an inter-chassis backup channel and a peer IP address and enables backup tunnel authentication.
The undo remote-backup interface peer command restores the default configuration.
By default, no interface of an inter-chassis backup channel or peer IP address is specified.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface of an inter-chassis backup channel.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the peer IPv4 address of an inter-chassis backup channel.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an authentication key for an inter-chassis backup channel.
The value is a string of 8 to 16 case-sensitive characters in plaintext or a string of 48 case-sensitive characters in ciphertext. The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

Specifies the type and number of an interface of an inter-chassis backup channel.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In an inter-chassis hot backup scenario, backup packets are transmitted along an intermediate link between the master and backup devices, and a backup channel needs to be established between HA chassis. If the remote-backup interface peer command is not run to configure an inter-chassis backup channel, inter-chassis backup fails.
Note the following issues about the HA dual-device inter-chassis backup channel:
If the two CGN devices in inter-chassis hot backup reside within the same equipment room, connect them using physical optical fibers or a cable.If a switch or an L2VPN resides between the two CGN devices, HA packets may be obtained and tampered with or used to initiate replay attacks by a third party, causing the devices to become abnormal. In this situation, configure the authentication-key key-value parameter to enable authentication for HA backup between the chassis to improve security.

Prerequisites
Basic NAT functions have been enabled on the master and backup devices.
Precautions
The remote-backup interface peer command can only be used in inter-chassis backup scenarios.The HA backup group (service-location) cannot be used in IPsec, and the interface of the remote backup tunnel can be set to an Eth-Trunk interface or its sub-interface, GE interface or its sub-interface, global-VE sub-interface, or VE sub-interface.When you configure authentication, configure the same authentication key on both ends, which prevents inter-chassis backup failures.
The remote-backup command takes effect only on VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
You are advised to use the MACsec function to improve the security of the remote backup tunnel.If an HA backup group (service-location) is bound to a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-E, note the following issues:If the vrrp trace command is run before authentication is enabled for the inter-chassis backup channel, setting the VRRP switchback delay time to 400s is recommended for the HA backup group.After authentication is enabled for the inter-chassis backup channel, setting the VRRP switchback delay time to 1200s is recommended.If an HA backup group (service-location) is bound to a VSUI-160-E, note the following issues:If the vrrp trace command is run before authentication is enabled for the inter-chassis backup channel, setting the VRRP switchback delay time to 800s is recommended for the HA backup group.After authentication is enabled for the inter-chassis backup channel, setting the VRRP switchback delay time to 2400s is recommended.remote-backup interface { interface-type interface-number | interface-name } peer ip-address authentication-key key-value is conflict with the command set master-key.
